title:
Derivation of the Gross-Pitaevskii Dynamics through Renormalized
  Excitation Number Operators
abstract:
We revisit the time evolution of initially trapped Bose-Einstein condensates
in the Gross-Pitaevskii regime. We show that the system continues to exhibit
BEC once the trap has been released and that the dynamics of the condensate is
described by the time-dependent Gross-Pitaevskii equation. Like the recent work
\cite{BS}, we obtain optimal bounds on the number of excitations orthogonal to
the condensate state. In contrast to \cite{BS}, however, whose main strategy
consists of controlling the number of excitations with regards to a suitable
fluctuation dynamics $t\mapsto e^{-B_t} e^{-iH_Nt}$ with renormalized
generator, our proof is based on controlling renormalized excitation number
operators directly with regards to the Schr\"odinger dynamics $t\mapsto
e^{-iH_Nt}$.
